intro: Sending government overthrowing documents to wikileaks has stronger security requirements than participating in a company survey. Using postilotta is adequate for all of it, but make sure that the rest of your 'communication set up' fits the appropriate security level as well.
list:
• Never ever click on links in emails. We don't even sent you any but the notifications about new messages, and these mails never include links.
  • Don't tell anybody about your message (Yes, trivial. Just do it...).
  • Handle your key-file(s) with great care.
  • Don't use company-owned hardware.
  • Use a network access not related to you, but still trustworthy.
  • Use ExtraSecure to add an additional, independent AES-Encryption-Layer for a session.
  • Use a non-permanent operating system e.g. Tails, which you can boot from USB.
  • Use a dedicated device (we are planning a related project... coming soon).
thumbrule: As a rule of thumb: Take care of your generated key-file, browser, device and internet access point, we take care of the rest.
